alert.note: Alert for Orange; San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 22 at 12:26AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 125 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Orange and San Diego. * WHEN...Until 125 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1219 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Peak hourly rainfall to around 0.65 inch at Point Loma and Shelter Island. There have been radar estimates to around 1.25 inch in one hour off the coast. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Anaheim, Santa Ana, Chula Vista, Irvine, Huntington Beach, Garden Grove, Oceanside, Orange, Costa Mesa and Carlsbad. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
